passages.text: Australia | Metals & Mining Aeries Resources

FY25 results broadly met our expectation, albeit with lower revenue realisation from Mt Colin as the asset transitioned into C&M. Portfolio simplification enhances focus on higher- quality organic growth at Constellation and Cracow. Internally funded CFs are supported by Cracow's gold leverage, and Murrawoombie OP feed. Liquidity remains contingent of FY26 operational delivery, working capital release timing, and project capex cadence. Reiterate HOLD, PT AUD0.24.

FY25 Results - Mt Colin revenue miss, tax loss utilisation benefit. EBITDA of \(\) 164m\(was lower than our forecast, Mt Colin revenue underperforming our expectation. Lower revenues and higher exploration costs were partially offset by lower operating costs and tax, leading to a slight miss at NPAT/EPS. Receivables jumped to\) \ \(25m\) at year- end, largely from late- Q4 Tritton shipments. OpCFs of \(\) 131m\(increasingly support internally funded reinvestments, with sustaining and growth capex plus exploration of\) \ \(98m\) . We note the \(\) 434m\(available tax losses and\) \ \(335m\) unrecognised losses, equating to a potential DTA of \(\) 100m\(, we model no tax paid across FY26 - 28.

Balance sheet and liquidity. Closing cash of \(\) 28m\(was pre - released. Liquidity of\) \ \(59m\) is underpinned by \(\) 21m\(receivables, and\) \ \(10m\) undrawn WHSP facility. Net debt of \(\) 27m\(yields a gearing of\) \sim 8\% \(. The new\) \ \(60m\) guarantee facility and the extension of the \(\) 50m\(WHP term facility to 31 - Aug - 26 provide runway and surety on bonding. The term facility costs BBSY\) +11\% \(cash, cheaper refi following Constellation development would be a tailwind. We see FY26 gearing towards\) 9.7\% \(and Net Debt/EBITDA to 0.2x. AIS continues to assess portfolio simplification to recycle capital, including potential inorganic M&A opportunities.

Tritton remains a core pillar for earnings and growth. Following a strong FY25 finish, we expect a strong FY26 start leveraging the 77kt RoM stockpiles built from Murra OP Stage 1. We expect Murra OP to contribute \(\sim 50\%\) feed and see production 2H- weighted, and assume an average throughput of 1.575 Mtpa, below its 1.8 Mtpa target rate. Constellation EIS has been submitted and due Nov- 2025; an updated study is due in Q2- FY26 envisioning a materially larger OP; we expect OP production of a 2- 4Mt, \(\sim 2.5\%\) Cu open pit by \(\sim\) \(\) 75 - 95m\(capex) FY27/28. This is likely to be followed by Kurrajong, then South Wing developments to sustain production. We model \(\) 540m\(yr growth capital, and\) \sim \(\) 55m\(yr sustaining capital over the LoM.

Cracow gold exposure elevating the near- term portfolio. Cracow continues to leverage the high gold price to explore options for meaningful mine life extensions. Cracow's Golden Plateau low- grade \(\) 1.5- 2.5g/tAu\(large - scale (3 - 6Mt ore) OP is an emerging project aiming to sustain mine life and maximise asset potential, instead of the current strategy targeting discrete high- grade stops. Investment into a TSF lift will commence in 1Q26. Post balance date AIS hedged 2020 at A\ \(5,146/oz through Jun - 26, half of FY26 midpoint production guidance for Cracow.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5 - 10 of this report. \\* Jefferies (Australia) Pty Ltd

Figure 2 - AERIS Forecast Changes

Aeris Resources is transitioning into a leaner, two- asset producer with nearterm leverage to the gold and copper price, while retaining identifiable growth opportunities. Delivery to production guidance should reconcile the discrepancy and dissipate the market discount created through a scepticism to operational delivery following the acquisition of the Round Oak Minerals assets. However, the investment case remains tempered by a capital- intensive development pipeline underpinning longer- dated copper optionality, requiring further disclosure. We see Aeris as a leveraged play on the copper thematic.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Our base- case PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples. We assume Operational continuity, and a modest amount of Resource conversion at Tritton, a 20- month mine life at Cracow, and a 10- month mine life at Mt Colin. We currently do not include Jaguar restart, or Barbara in our base case valuation.

Our upside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples, utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) higher commodity price deck. We see upside value through a positive outcome at Jaguar restart and/or Barbara studies, and upside to our modelled Stockman project.

Our downside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples, utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) lower commodity price deck. Realisation of the elevated risks at Tritton for operational continuity, or negative study outcomes for the several projects in the AIS portfolio.

Top Material Issue(s): Key issues for the sector include the consideration of traditional owners of the land on which mines are located, net- zero targets and actions being taken to achieve set goals, and workforce safety and structure, for example, local community hired vs Fly- in, Fly- out workers.
Company Target(s): 1) No emissions targets. 2) Targets have been set. 3) Group TRIFR was 13.7 for FY22. 4) Female representation is at \(17\%\) .

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What component of your energy usage is derived from renewable energy sources? (Both fixed infrastructure, 2) mill, and mobile, eg. haul fleet) 2) What are your scope one, two, and three emissions? 3) Whose the traditional owners of the land on which you operate? What are your interactions with them? 4) How are you looking to increase safety across your operations?

- Constellation feasibility work for a larger open-pit component, and maiden reserve (Q2 FY26), Tritton Deeps (ventilation upgrade), Stockman, Jaguar restart and Barbara;- Tritton sustainable 1.8 Mtpa throughput;- Cracow Resource / Reserve ounce-pipeline;- North Queensland divestment;- Refinancing the WHSF term facility maturing 31-Aug-26;- Stockman approvals, partners or study updates.

Figure 4 - Aeries Resources - Operational Summary
Source: Company Reports, Jefferies

Aeris ResourcesAeris Resources is a mid- tier base and precious metals producer. Its copper- dominant portfolio comprises four operating assets, a long- life development project, and a highly prospective exploration portfolio, spanning Queensland, Western Australia, New South Wales, and Victoria, with headquarters in Brisbane. Aeris has a strong pipeline of organic growth projects, has an aggressive exploration program, and continues to investigate strategic merger and acquisition opportunities. The company's experienced board and management team bring significant corporate and technical expertise to a lean operating model. Aeris is committed to building strong partnerships with its key community, investment, and workforce stakeholders.

Our PT is based on a blend of NPV, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples. Risks: merger, acquisition and divestment, commodity market cycle, balance sheet liquidity, project development, execution and delivery, geotechnical stability, third- party performance, and supply chain.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed
Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries is acting as a manager or co- manager in the underwriting or placement of securities for Aeris Resources or one of its affiliates.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigng ratings may include the fllowing: market capitalization, maturity, growth/val, volatility and expected total retun over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
